command: bash -lc 'set -euo pipefail; ts=$(date -u +%FT%TZ); d=$(date -u +%F); dest=/opt/ti/closed/cloud/$d; mkdir -p "$dest"; if scp -q -i /etc/ssh/keys/cloudintel_ed25519 -o StrictHostKeyChecking=yes -o UserKnownHostsFile=/etc/ssh/known_hosts_cloudintel -o IdentitiesOnly=yes subscriber@sftp.cloudintel.pro:/exports/cloud/assets/acme_corp/latest.json{,.sha256} "$dest"/ && (cd "$dest" && sha256sum -c latest.json.sha256); then printf "{\"timestamp\":\"%s\",\"technique\":\"T1597\",\"source\":\"cloudintel-pro\",\"artifact\":\"%s/latest.json\",\"status\":\"verified\"}\n" "$ts" "$dest" | tee -a /var/log/ti_fetch.json; else printf "{\"timestamp\":\"%s\",\"technique\":\"T1597\",\"source\":\"cloudintel-pro\",\"status\":\"error\"}\n" "$ts" >&2; fi'
explanation: Acquires a subscription cloud asset inventory (JSON) for the target from a closed-source provider using SFTP with integrity checks, consistent with T1597.
rationale_steps: Connect to the vendor SFTP endpoint with pinned host key and SSH key auth.
Download latest cloud asset JSON and its checksum.
Validate integrity with sha256sum and archive in date-stamped path.
Output structured JSON status for logging pipelines.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with balanced quotes, proper command separators, valid flags, appropriate error handling with set -euo pipefail, and correct use of variables and subshells.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with T1597 (Search Closed Sources) as it securely retrieves subscription-based threat intelligence from a closed source (cloudintel.pro) using SFTP with proper authentication, integrity verification, and logging.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed, exhibiting correct bash syntax, balanced quoting, valid flags for all commands, proper command separators, and appropriate use of brace expansion and subshells.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with T1597, using SFTP to acquire data from a 'closed-source provider' with integrity checks, which is operationally plausible for automated intelligence gathering from a subscribed feed.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: Balanced quoting and parentheses with valid scp options, correct brace expansion, and proper command chaining make it well-formed.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It credibly acquires a closed-source artifact via authenticated SSH and verifies/logs it consistent with T1597, though default permissions on /opt may hinder execution without elevated rights and it uses scp instead of sftp.
